edu.stanford.math.plex4.homology.zigzag

Class BasisTrackingUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.math.plex4.homology.zigzag.BasisTrackingUtility

  • public class BasisTrackingUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains various static functions for assisting with zigzag homology computations.
    Author:
    Andrew Tausz

                                                                                                                     PrimitiveBasisElement[] objects)
        This function creates a new formal sum from the given set of coefficients and objects.
        Type Parameters:
        X -
        Parameters:
        coefficients - the array of coefficients
        objects - the array of basis elements - they must be of type X
        Returns:
        a formal sum containing the given coefficients and basis elements

      • low

        public static <X> X low(edu.stanford.math.primitivelib.autogen.formal_sum.IntSparseFormalSum<X> chain,
        java.util.Comparator<X> comparator)
        This function computes the operation low_A(j) as described in the paper. Note that if the chain is empty (for example the column contains only zeros), then this function returns null.
        Type Parameters:
        X - the underlying type of the basis elements in the chain
        Parameters:
        chain - the chain
        comparator - the comparator to use
        Returns:
        the lowest element in the chain

      • multiply

        public static <X,Y> edu.stanford.math.primitivelib.autogen.formal_sum.IntSparseFormalSum<Y> multiply(java.util.Map<X,edu.stanford.math.primitivelib.autogen.formal_sum.IntSparseFormalSum<Y>> m,
                                                                                     edu.stanford.math.primitivelib.autogen.formal_sum.IntSparseFormalSum<X> v,
                                                                                     edu.stanford.math.primitivelib.autogen.algebraic.IntAbstractField field)
        This function performs matrix multiplication. The matrix is represented by a sparse set of sparse columns. In other words, this function computes the linear combination of the columns in the specified map with coefficients given by the vector v. In the matrix m, the keys represent the column labels, and the values are the columns at that particular index.
        Type Parameters:
        X -
        Y -
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix as a list of columns
        v - the vector
        field - the field over which to perform the computations
        Returns:
        the matrix vector product

      • multiply

        public static <X,Y,Z> java.util.Map<Z,edu.stanford.math.primitivelib.autogen.formal_sum.IntSparseFormalSum<Y>> multiply(java.util.Map<X,edu.stanford.math.primitivelib.autogen.formal_sum.IntSparseFormalSum<Y>> a,
                                                                                                        java.util.Map<Z,edu.stanford.math.primitivelib.autogen.formal_sum.IntSparseFormalSum<X>> b,
                                                                                                        edu.stanford.math.primitivelib.autogen.algebraic.IntAbstractField field)
        This function performs matrix-matrix multiplication. The matrices are represented by a sparse set of sparse columns.
        Type Parameters:
        X -
        Y -
        Z -
        Parameters:
        a - the first matrix
        b - the second matrix
        field - the field over which to perform the computations
        Returns:
        the matrix-matrix product a*b

      • findColumnWithGivenLow

        public static <Y> int findColumnWithGivenLow(java.util.List<edu.stanford.math.primitivelib.autogen.formal_sum.IntSparseFormalSum<Y>> m,
                             Y low,
                             java.util.Comparator<Y> comparator)
        This function finds the index of the first column such that the column's low value is the value specified. If no such column exists, it returns -1.
        Type Parameters:
        Y -
        Parameters:
        m - the set of columns to search
        low - the low value to search for
        comparator - the comparator which performs the comparison within type Y
        Returns:
        the index of the first column with the given low, and -1 if no such column exists

      • findColumnWithGivenLow

        public static <X,Y> X findColumnWithGivenLow(java.util.Map<X,edu.stanford.math.primitivelib.autogen.formal_sum.IntSparseFormalSum<Y>> m,
                             Y low,
                             java.util.Comparator<Y> comparator)
        This function finds the index of the first column such that the column's low value is the value specified. If no such column exists, it returns null.
        Type Parameters:
        X -
        Y -
        Parameters:
        m - the set of columns to search
        low - the low value to search for
        comparator - the comparator which performs the comparison within type Y
        Returns:
        the index of the first column with the given low, and null if no such column exists

        Parameters:

      • findFirstIndexContainingElement

        public static <X,Y> X findFirstIndexContainingElement(java.util.Map<X,edu.stanford.math.primitivelib.autogen.formal_sum.IntSparseFormalSum<Y>> m,
                                      Y element,
                                      java.util.Comparator<X> comparator)
        This function returns the lowest index such that the given element is found in the chain at that index. If no such index is found, it returns null.
        Type Parameters:
        X -
        Y -
        Parameters:
        m - the set of chains
        element - the element to search for
        comparator - provides comparison for the indices of m
        Returns:
        the lowest index of the chains containing the given element

                                     Y element,
                                     java.util.Comparator<X> comparator)

        Type Parameters:
        X -
        Y -
        Parameters:
        m - the set of chains
        element - the element to search for
        comparator - provides comparison for the indices of m

      • getAscendingIndicesContainingElement

        public static <X,Y> java.util.List<X> getAscendingIndicesContainingElement(java.util.Map<X,edu.stanford.math.primitivelib.autogen.formal_sum.IntSparseFormalSum<Y>> m,
                                                           Y element,
                                                           java.util.Comparator<X> comparator)
        This function returns the set of indices such that the chains at the indices contain the given element. The indices are returned in sorted order. In the event that no indices are found, it returns the empty list.
        Type Parameters:
        X -
        Y -
        Parameters:
        m - the set of chains
        element - the element to search for
        comparator - provides comparison for the indices of m
        Returns:
        the ascending set of indices containing the element
